# memoryBalloonDevices

**Instance Property**

The array of devices that you use to adjust the amount of memory available to the guest system.

## Declaration

```swift
var memoryBalloonDevices: [VZMemoryBalloonDevice] { get }
```

## Discussion

If you included a [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtioTraditionalMemoryBalloonDeviceConfiguration] object in the configuration of your VM, this property contains a corresponding [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtioTraditionalMemoryBalloonDevice] object. Use that object to adjust the amount of memory available to the guest operating system.

If you didn’t include a memory balloon object in your configuration, this property contains an empty array.

## Configuring VM attributes at runtime

- **consoleDevices**: The list of configured console devices on the VM.
- **networkDevices**: The list of configured network devices on the VM.
- **socketDevices**: The array of socket devices that the VM configures for use ports in the guest VM.
- **directorySharingDevices**: The list of configured directory-sharing devices on the VM.
- **usbControllers**: The list of runtime USB controller objects.
